title-group.article-title: Intellectuals and Social Movements in Process of Transformation

abstract.p: The article contributes to the ongoing debate on the Polish intelligentsia and the role of intellectuals in the politics. The pre-war Polish state is characterized by its domination by intelligentsia, furthering its self-assigned modernizing mission. Communism was reinterpreted as offering another chance for this purpose and when this stagnated, the Solidarity revolution put forward a third chance. The anti-populist argument is seen as expressing the intelligentsia's concern about preserving its unique position. The rarity of university-level education supports this aim while new careers in business undermine it.
